page.title: 13ALNWICK STATION
page.content:
Alnwick station was built with sandstone. The furniture is mainly wood and in the waiting room there was a fire place with NER, North Eastern Railways. The line was in two parts, one goes to Alnmouth and the other goes to Coldstream. Part of the station has been taken to Beamish Folk Museum in County Durham for exhibition on trains.
In the waiting room there was only one window that gave very little light. In the winter there would be a fire so that people could be warm, but in the summer the fire would not be lit so it would be quite cold and dark. There was only one train on the line at one time because it was a single track. There are no trains now, and the station is closed. The building is used for industry.
